# init(context:window:delegate:)

**Initializer**

Initializes and returns an app controller.

## Declaration

```swift
init(context: TVApplicationControllerContext, window: UIWindow?, delegate: (any TVApplicationControllerDelegate)?)
```

## Parameters

- **context**: A [doc://com.apple.tvmlkit/documentation/TVMLKit/TVApplicationControllerContext] object containing information about the JavaScript app.
- **window**: A [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIWindow] object that presents the application controller’s navigation controller.
- **delegate**: The app controller delegate.

## Return Value

The initialized [doc://com.apple.tvmlkit/documentation/TVMLKit/TVApplicationController] object.

## Discussion

An app controller coordinates activity between the JavaScript environments and tvOS. There are three options when presenting the application controller. If you provide a valid [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIWindow] object, the application controller’s navigation controller is presented immediately and managed by [doc://com.apple.tvmlkit/documentation/TVMLKit/TVApplicationController]. If no window is provided, the navigation controller can be presented and dismissed manually within the binary app. Finally, if you wish to present native view controllers alongside a [doc://com.apple.tvmlkit/documentation/TVMLKit/TVApplicationController] object, you can push additional view controllers onto [doc://com.apple.tvmlkit/documentation/TVMLKit/TVApplicationController/navigationController].
